So there we were, probably the only two girls in all of Barcelona named Sharon sitting at a table at Tantarantana's front terrace.  On probably the hottest day of the summer, this shady spot was pleasant, and relatively quiet... the perfect place for a mid-day bite.  Now the restaurant is a narrow strip extending the length of the block, with an upstairs dining area, and patio seating in both the front and the back.  The atmosphere inside was charming - but way too hot on this day in question.  We both got the mini hamburguesas - which are nothing like "sliders" for you american readers.  an order of this appetizer/small plate is 2 strips of "pan de coca", and 4 mini burgers set atop a bed of grilled onions (2 burgers on each strip of "coca").   Dotted with dollops of tapenade and mayo - this dish was quite savory.  I really liked that toasted "pan de coca".  prices seemed fair on the rest of the menu - with most items between 8 & 12 euros.  They had tapas, salads & egg dishes among others - i didn't really read the menu though.
